hanzi-su-wiki:
笑

Значения

Смеяться; улыбаться

Мнемоника

  • Человек с запрокинутой головой 夭, трясущийся от смеха, как бамбук 竹 на ветру.

  • "Человек смеётся тяжело 'Ke-ke' (ケケ)".

xiào
laugh; smile; Classifiers: 个
смех; улыбка; Классификаторы: 个

heisig_chinese_memo: When the people tried to build a tower of bamboo to reach the heavens, the gods just laughed and laughed.
koohiiStory1: When the people tried to build a tower of bamboo to reach the heavens, the gods just laughed and laughed.
koohiiStory2: That Panda is in bamboo heaven! Just look at him laugh!
jp_example_words:
あざ笑う(あざわらう): to sneer at, to ridicule
可笑しい(おかしい): strange, funny, amusing, ridiculous
微笑(びしょう): smile
笑顔(えがお): smiling face
微笑む(ほほえむ): to smile
笑い(わらい): laugh, laughter, smile
笑う(わらう): laugh
jp_readingExamples: 笑む (え.む), 笑う (わら.う)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Bamboo heaven is a place for laughing. Bamboo is a very jolly plant, and they love to laugh. Even after death in bamboo heaven, the bamboo continue to laugh joyfully. Bamboo heaven is truly a place of laughter.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine yourself as a bamboo plant that laughs in heaven. What are you laughing about? Chuckle to yourself as you remember this kanji.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: There’s actually a war a goin’ on up in that there bamboo heaven, y’know? Ye might not have heard of it with all that there laughin’ a goin’ on, but there definitely be a war a (わら) goin’ on up in bamboo heaven, y’hear? The bamboo are scared so that’s why they be laughin’ so much. They nervous.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Now picture these bamboo again up in bamboo heaven, and remember this strange accent to remember that the bamboo plants up in bamboo heaven are laughing with nervous laughter at this bamboo war that’s a goin’ on up there.
Ru_trainchinese: xiào: (глаг) смеяться, улыбаться; высмеивать, насмехаться над
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the bamboo (⺮) with the calamity (夭) laughs
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When the people tried to build a tower of bamboo to reach the heavens, the gods just laughed and laughed.
origin_of_ch_char_book: (听, ting, hear) shows a mouth and an ear (耳, er, ear). It is a scene of the loud sound, and listening to the sound. This character used to mean “to laugh with mouth open” before. But now this symbol is used for “listening” instead of the old symbol 聽 (ting, hear) which is too complicated for a common word. (笑, xiao=Hsiao, laugh) Above are bamboo tree’s leaves, and a person is laughing loudly with his neck bent backward .
humanum_full_description_en:
From " bamboo ", from " yao ", the original meaning is to make your face or make a sound out of joy. " Laughter " in ancient Chinese characters is derived from "艸", from " dog ", and after Xiaozhuan is from " bamboo " and from " dog ". In the Tang Dynasty, Li Yangbing published "Shuowen" and changed it from " bamboo " to " yao ", which is the basis of today's " laugh ". "Zeng Yun‧ Xiao Yun": "Laugh, happy and untie the face." The classics use the original meaning, such as "Deng Xizi‧ Wu Hou": "Those who suffer from physical pain can't help but speak, and those who are happy can't help but smile." On behalf of Guo Pu's "Youxian Poem": "Ling concubine cares about me and laughs, and she enlightens her jade teeth." The original meaning is also used in the scriptures and silks. The real valley is not flowery, it is not decorated, it is not laughed."

" Laughter " can be extended to envy and affection. For example, Meng Jiao in the Tang Dynasty "Snow": "It is intended to persuade Mo to laugh at the snow, and to laugh at the poor as a disaster." Xin Qiji of the Song Dynasty (Partridge Heaven-Zheng Shouhou Hou Qing Xie Yu Boshan at the table): "The brothers of the Jun family are really laughable, and Xie Xie can build Wufeng Tower. ."

" Laughter " can also mean ridicule. "Mencius·Lianghui King": "How about laughing at a hundred steps with fifty steps?" "Warring States Policy‧Qi Ce Five": "However, Bo Zhi died, and he was a laughter in the world, what is it?"

" Laugh " can also mean something ridiculous or used as a respectful speech. The former is like Han Yu's "Shunzong Real Record III" in the Tang Dynasty: "The people are suffering, and they think that they laugh." The latter is like Zhao Mengfu's "Book with Friends" in the Yuan Dynasty: "It expresses the slightest thoughts, and Fu Ji laughs."
humanum_short_description_en: From " bamboo ", from " yao ", the original meaning is to make your face or make a sound out of joy.
humanum_full_description:
從「竹」，從「夭」，本義為因喜悅而開顏或發聲。「笑」在古文字中從「艸」，從「犬」，後小篆訛為從「竹」，從「犬」。唐代李陽冰刊定《說文》改為從「竹」，從「夭」，為今天「笑」字之所本。《增韻‧笑韻》：「笑，喜而解顏啟齒也。」典籍用本義，如《鄧析子‧無厚》：「體痛者口不能不呼，心悅者顏不能不笑。」晉代郭璞〈遊仙詩〉：「靈妃顧我笑，粲然啟玉齒。」簡帛文字也用本義，如《馬王堆‧老子乙本卷前古佚書‧稱》第152行：「實穀不華，至言不飾，至樂不笑。」

　　「笑」可引申為欣羨、喜愛。如唐代孟郊〈雪〉：「意勸莫笑雪，笑雪貧為災。」 宋代辛棄疾〈鷓鴣天‧鄭守厚卿席上謝余伯山〉：「君家兄弟真堪笑，箇箇能修五鳳樓。」

　　「笑」也可表示譏笑。《孟子‧梁惠王上》：「以五十步笑百步，則何如？」《戰國策‧齊策五》：「然而智伯卒身死國亡，為天下笑者，何謂也？」

　　「笑」還可表示可笑之事或用作敬辭。前者如唐代韓愈《順宗實錄三》：「百姓苦之，遠近以為笑。」後者如元代趙孟頫〈與友人書〉：「以表微意，伏冀笑領。」
humanum_short_description: 從「竹」，從「夭」，本義為因喜悅而開顏或發聲。

從「 竹 」，從「 夭 」，本義為因喜悅而開顏或發聲。「 笑 」在古文字中從「 艸 」，從「 犬 」，後小篆訛為從「 竹 」，從「 犬 」。唐代李陽冰刊定《說文》改為從「 竹 」，從「 夭 」，為今天「 笑 」字之所本。《增韻‧笑韻》：「笑，喜而解顏啟齒也。」典籍用本義，如《鄧析子‧無厚》：「體痛者口不能不呼，心悅者顏不能不笑。」晉代郭璞〈遊仙詩〉：「靈妃顧我笑，粲然啟玉齒。」簡帛文字也用本義，如《馬王堆‧老子乙本卷前古佚書‧稱》第152行：「實穀不華，至言不飾，至樂不笑。」 「 笑 」可引申為欣羨、喜愛。如唐代孟郊〈雪〉：「意勸莫笑雪，笑雪貧為災。」 宋代辛棄疾〈鷓鴣天‧鄭守厚卿席上謝余伯山〉：「君家兄弟真堪笑，箇箇能修五鳳樓。」 「 笑 」也可表示譏笑。《孟子‧梁惠王上》：「以五十步笑百步，則何如？」《戰國策‧齊策五》：「然而智伯卒身死國亡，為天下笑者，何謂也？」 「 笑 」還可表示可笑之事或用作敬辭。前者如唐代韓愈《順宗實錄三》：「百姓苦之，遠近以為笑。」後者如元代趙孟頫〈與友人書〉：「以表微意，伏冀笑領。」
From " bamboo", from " yao", the original meaning is to make your face or make a sound out of joy. " Laughter" in ancient Chinese characters is derived from " 艸", from " dog", and after Xiaozhuan is from " bamboo" and from " dog". In the Tang Dynasty, Li Yangbing published "Shuowen" and changed it from " bamboo" to " yao", which is the basis of today's " laugh". "Zeng Yun‧ Xiao Yun": "Laugh, happy and untie the face." The classics use the original meaning, such as "Deng Xizi‧ Wu Hou": "Those who suffer from physical pain can't help but speak, and those who are happy can't help but smile." On behalf of Guo Pu's "Youxian Poem": "Ling concubine cares about me and laughs, and she enlightens her jade teeth." The original meaning is also used in the scriptures and silks. The real valley is not flowery, it is not decorated, it is not laughed." " Laughter" can be extended to envy and affection. For example, Meng Jiao in the Tang Dynasty "Snow": "It is intended to persuade Mo to laugh at the snow, and to laugh at the poor as a disaster." Xin Qiji of the Song Dynasty (Partridge Heaven-Zheng Shouhou Hou Qing Xie Yu Boshan at the table): "The brothers of the Jun family are really laughable, and Xie Xie can build Wufeng Tower. ." " Laughter" can also mean ridicule. "Mencius·Lianghui King": "How about laughing at a hundred steps with fifty steps?" "Warring States Policy‧Qi Ce Five": "However, Bo Zhi died, and he was a laughter in the world, what is it?" " Laugh" can also mean something ridiculous or used as a respectful speech. The former is like Han Yu's "Shunzong Real Record III" in the Tang Dynasty: "The people are suffering, and they think that they laugh." The latter is like Zhao Mengfu's "Book with Friends" in the Yuan Dynasty: "It expresses the slightest thoughts, and Fu Ji laughs."

笑字的基本解释

笑
xiào
露出愉快的表情，发出欢喜的声音：笑容。笑颜。笑眯眯。谈笑风生。
讥嘲：笑柄。笑话。笑谈。贻笑大方。嘲笑。见笑。耻笑。
哭啼

笑字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiào］
［《廣韻》私妙切，去笑，心。］
“咲1”的今字。亦作“1”。亦作“1”。
(1)显露愉悦的表情，发出欣喜的声音。
(2)讥笑；嘲笑。
(3)玩笑；逗乐。
(4)指可笑的事。
(5)喜爱；羡慕。
(6)比喻花朵开放。

笑字的英文翻译

◎ 笑
laugh, laughter

笑字的康熙字典解释

【未集上】【竹字部】　笑； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页879第03
〔古文〕咲?【廣韻】私妙切【集韻】【韻會】仙妙切【正韻】蘇弔切，?音肖。【廣韻】欣也，喜也。【增韻】喜而解顏啓齒也。又嗤也，哂也。【易·萃卦】一握爲笑。【詩·邶風】顧我則笑。【毛傳】侮之也。【禮·曲禮】父母有疾，笑不至矧。【註】齒本曰矧，大笑則見。【左傳·哀二十年】吳王曰：溺人必笑。【論語】夫子莞爾而笑。【註】小笑貌。　又獸名。【廣東新語】人熊，一名山笑。　又【韻補】思邀切。【詩·大雅】勿以爲笑，叶上囂、下蕘。【淮南子·汜論訓】不殺黃口，不獲二毛，于古爲義，于今爲笑。【古逸詩·趙童謠】趙爲號，秦爲笑。以爲不信，視地上生毛。　又入宥韻，音秀。【江總詩】玉臉含啼還自笑，若使琴心一曲奏。　或作咲。【前漢·揚雄傳】樵夫咲之。　亦省作关。【前漢·薛宣傳】一关相樂。

笑字的源字形

笑字的起名意思

：露出愉快的表情，发出欢喜的声；指人的快乐和欢喜。

laugh
Basic explanation of words
laugh
xiào
With a happy expression and a joyous voice: smile. Smile. Smiled. Talk and laugh happily.
Mocking: laughing stock. joke. Laugh. Laughing and generous. fling in teeth. Just laugh. Ridicule.

laugh
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiào］
["Guangyun" secretly cut, laugh, heart. ]
The present character of "咲1". Also called "1". Also known as "1".
(1) Show a happy expression and make a happy voice.
(2) ridicule; ridicule.
(3) A joke; amused.
(4) Refers to ridiculous things.
(5) Love; Envy.
(6) It is a metaphor for the blooming of flowers.

laugh
Source glyph
laugh
Name meaning
：Showing a happy expression and making a joyful sound; referring to people’s happiness and joy.
会意字。从竹(竹子),从天(弯曲),竹被风吹弯且发出声响,如人笑时常曲体弯腰发出笑声。本义是欢笑。
①露出愉快的表情,发出欢快的声音:~容|欢~|谈~
风生。2讥笑;嘲笑:见~「耻~|始~大方。
~柄 ~话 ~脸 ~语 ~里藏刀 ~逐颜开 暗~
嘲~ 含~ 好~ 讥~ 好~ 可~ 苦~冷~
取~ 傻~ 说~ 玩~ 微~ 啼~皆非 眉开眼~

Первоначальное значение - смех.
① Со счастливым выражением лица и веселым голосом: ~ Rong | huan ~ | Talk ~ Fengsheng.

смех
Улыбнись, смейся.
xiào
I гл.
1) смеяться; улыбаться; смеющийся; с улыбкой, весело смеясь
眉开眼笑 радостное выражение лица
开笑口 смеяться во весь рот

смех; улыбка
逗个笑 диал. вызвать смех, рассмешить

不值一笑 не стоить (не заслуживать) даже улыбки

笑

Значения

Смеяться; улыбаться

Мнемоника

  • Человек с запрокинутой головой 夭, трясущийся от смеха, как бамбук 竹 на ветру.

  • "Человек смеётся тяжело 'Ke-ke' (ケケ)".
Radicals: 竹, 天  (bamboo, heaven)
Meaning Mnemonic
Bamboo heaven is a place for laughing. Bamboo is a very jolly plant, and they love to laugh. Even after death in bamboo heaven, the bamboo continue to laugh joyfully. Bamboo heaven is truly a place of laughter.
Imagine yourself as a bamboo plant that laughs in heaven. What are you laughing about? Chuckle to yourself as you remember this kanji.
Reading Mnemonic
There’s actually a war a goin’ on up in that there bamboo heaven, y’know? Ye might not have heard of it with all that there laughin’ a goin’ on, but there definitely be a war a (わら) goin’ on up in bamboo heaven, y’hear? The bamboo are scared so that’s why they be laughin’ so much. They nervous.
Now picture these bamboo again up in bamboo heaven, and remember this strange accent to remember that the bamboo plants up in bamboo heaven are laughing with nervous laughter at this bamboo war that’s a goin’ on up there.
